html: The synonymous parallelism of forests and cities signifies that besides its literal meaning the term “forests” functions as a metaphor for “cities”—just as mountains functions as a metaphor for kingdoms or nations and trees for people (Isaiah 13:4; 61:3; 64:1-3 ). The one who fells the forests or levels the cities is the king of Assyria/Babylon, Jehovah’s axe and saw (Isaiah 10:15; 14:8; 37:24 ). Identified with storm imagery in Jehovah’s Day of Judgment (Isaiah 8:7-8; 17:12-13; 28:15 ), he is the hail that flattens the habitations of the wicked in a Sodom-and-Gomorrah type of destruction (Isaiah 28:2, 17, 22 ).
